text: Marilyn "Mandy" Rice-Davies (21 October 1944 â€“ 18 December 2014) was a British model and showgirl. She was born in Mere, Wiltshire and grew up in Shirley, Warwickshire. She was best known for her role in the Profumo affair, which discredited the Conservative government of British Prime Minister, Harold Macmillan in 1963. Rice-Davies died aged 70 from cancer on 18 December 2014. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:2014 deaths Category:English models Category:Deaths from cancer Category:People from Warwickshire Category:People from Wiltshire
title: Mandy Rice-Davies
